data.components.ui package

Submodules

data.components.ui.button module

Module for displaying buttons on the screen.

Buttons consist of a base rectangle with a label on top. The label can be text or an image. The base rectangle can be hidden to use the image label as the button itself. In this case pixel-perfect collision can also be used. Buttons can be hovered and interacted with. An attribute of the button can change or an action can be executed when the button is pressed down or released.

data.components.ui.text module

Module for displaying text on the screen.

Text can be updated at any point and will rerender and update itself accordingly. Additionally, the WrappedText class can be used when wrapping is needed.

data.components.ui.text.text_rect_alignments

Stores the alignment type hints for the bounding rect in the WrappedText class.

data.components.ui.text.default_font_dir

Stores the directory to the default font to use if no font is passed in.

class data.components.ui.text.Text(position, text, font=None, font_size=32, color=(255, 255, 255, 255), align='topleft', antialias=False, surface=None)[source]

Bases: WidgetBase

Class for creating and displaying text on a surface.

Aligns and renders text using self._align_rect and self._render_text: can be updated in real time and will update the rect and re-render itself as needed. Only to be used when the text is non interactable and doesn’t need wrapping. Allows alligning the text to the coordinates provided.

x

The x coordinate of the text with reference to the alignment (given by self.align). Updates the rect of the Font when changed.

y

The y coordinate of the text with reference to the alignment (given by self.align). Updates the rect of the Font when changed.

text

The text to display. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

font

The font of the text. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

font_size

The size of the font. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

color

The color of the text. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

align

Alignment of the text coordinates. Updates the rect of the Font when changed.

surface

The surface that the text should be rendered to. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

Parameters:

  • position (tuple[int, int]) – The position of the text with reference to the align argument passed.

  • text (str) – The text to display.

  • font (Optional[Font]) – The font of the text. Defaults to None in order to use the default_font_dir.

  • font_size (int) – The size of the font, should only be used when the default font is used. Defaults to 32.

  • color (Color | tuple) – The color of the text. Defaults to white.

  • align (Literal['topleft', 'midtop', 'topright', 'midleft', 'center', 'midright', 'bottomleft', 'midbottom', 'bottomright']) – The point of the text rect that the position argument is referencing. Defaults to ‘topleft’.

  • antialias (bool) – Whether antialiasing should be used when rendering the text surface. Defaults to False.

  • surface (Optional[Surface]) – The surface that the text should be rendered to. Defaults to None to use the current display surface.

property antialias: bool

Whether antialiasing should be used when rendering text.

blit()[source]

Draws the text onto the surface.

color

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

font_size

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

property rect: Rect

The rect object of the text.

text

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

update()[source]

Rerenders the text surface and updates the position of the rect.

class data.components.ui.text.WrappedText(rect, text, font=None, font_size=32, color=(255, 255, 255, 255), align='topleft', text_align='left', antialias=False, line_spacing=0, surface=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class for creating and displaying wrapped text on a surface.

Text wraps according to the bounding rect argument passed. Text can be aligned to the left, right, center or justified in the bounding rect. Text that cannot fit inside the rect is not displayed. Changing font size after an object has been instantiated is not supported yet.

rect

The bounding rectangle that the text wraps with reference to.

text

The text to display. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

font

The font of the text. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

color

The color of the text. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

align

Alignment of the text coordinates. Updates the rect of the Font when changed.

text_align

The alignment of the text inside the rect.

surface

The surface that the text should be rendered to. Text surface is re-rendered upon being set.

Parameters:

  • rect (Rect) – The bounding rectangle that the text should fit in and wrap in accordance with.

  • text (str) – The text to display.

  • font (Optional[Font]) – The font of the text. Defaults to None in order to use the default_font_dir.

  • font_size (int) – The size of the font, should only be used when the default font is used. Defaults to 32.

  • color (Color | tuple) – The color of the text. Defaults to white.

  • align (Literal['topleft', 'midtop', 'topright', 'midleft', 'center', 'midright', 'bottomleft', 'midbottom', 'bottomright']) – The point of the text rect that the position argument is referencing. Defaults to ‘topleft’.

  • text_align (Literal['right', 'left', 'center', 'justified']) – The alignment of the text inside the bounding rect provided. Can be left, right, center or justified.

  • antialias (bool) – Whether antialiasing should be used when rendering the text surface. Defaults to False.

  • line_spacing (int) – The distance between new lines. Defaults to 0.

  • surface (Optional[Surface]) – The surface that the text should be rendered to. Defaults to the current display surface: pygame.display.get_surface.

align

Decorator that updates the _requires_alignment property to True.

property antialias: bool

Whether antialiasing should be used when rendering text.

blit()[source]

Draws the text onto the surface.

color

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

font

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

line_spacing

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

rect

Decorator that updates the _requires_alignment property to True.

text

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

update()[source]

Rerenders the text surface and updates the position of the rect.

data.components.ui.widgethandler module

Module containing a set of functions that are used to interact with all widgets added to the handler at once from a centralized location.

data.components.ui.widgethandler.widgets

An insertion-ordered set of widgets.

data.components.ui.widgethandler.add_widget(widget)[source]

Adds the widget given to an centralised ordered set of widgets.

Widgets must be added so that all the other functions relating to the widgets can work.

Parameters:

widget (WidgetBase) – The widget to add to the set.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.blit()[source]

Calls all the widgets’ blit() methods to render them onto the screen.

Widgets are rendered in the order they were added. Must be called once every game tick.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.move_to_bottom(widget)[source]

Moves the widget given to the bottom of the ordered set of widgets.

A widget at the bottom will be rendered under all other widgets (if they are overlapping) and will not recieve input if the overlapped part is interacted with.

Parameters:

widget (WidgetBase) – The widget to move to the bottom of the set.

Raises:

KeyError – If the widget is not in the set.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.move_to_top(widget)[source]

Moves the widget given to the top of the ordered set of widgets.

A widget at the top will be rendered over all other widgets (if they are overlapping) and will always recieve input even if if there are other widgets below that should recieve input.

Parameters:

widget (WidgetBase) – The widget to move to the top of the set.

Raises:

KeyError – If the widget is not in the set.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.remove_widget(widget)[source]

Removes the widget given from the ordered set of widgets.

Parameters:

widget (WidgetBase) – The widget to remove from the set.

Raises:

ValueError – If the widget is not in the set.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.update()[source]

Calls all the widgets’ update() methods. Update done varies by widget.

Widgets are updated in the order they were added. If widgets are overlapping, only the topmost widget will be updated. Must be called once every game tick.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgethandler.update_screen(screen)[source]

Updates the surface value for all of the widgets in the widget set.

Parameters:

screen (Surface) – The new surface that the widgets should render to.

Return type:

None

data.components.ui.widgetutils module

Module containing general widget utilities.

The widget base class is a base class meant to be inherited by all widgets. It is used to define basic properties such as coordinates and alignment, as well as methods for interacting with the widget handler functions.

There are also two decorators for widget properties that require updating the _requires_rerender and _requires_realignment properties upon being changed.

class data.components.ui.widgetutils.AlignmentNeeded[source]

Bases: Validator

Decorator that updates the _requires_alignment property to True.

class data.components.ui.widgetutils.RenderNeeded[source]

Bases: AlignmentNeeded

Decorator that updates the _requires_render property to True.

class data.components.ui.widgetutils.WidgetBase(position, align='topleft', surface=None, sub_widget=False)[source]

Bases: ABC

Base class for widgets.

Automatically adds itself to the widget hanlder.

x

The x coordinate of the widget with reference to the alignment (given by self.align). Aligns the widget when changed.

y

The y coordinate of the widget with reference to the alignment (given by self.align). Aligns the widget when changed.

align

Alignment of the rect coordinates. Aligns the widget when changed.

surface

The surface which the widget will be displayed on.

is_sub_widget

Boolean indicating if the widget is a subwidget.

A subwidget is ignored by all widgethandler methods (that would usually affect all widgets). True indicates the widget is a sub widget.

Parameters:

  • position (tuple[int, int]) – The position of the widget with reference to the align argument passed.

  • align (Literal['topleft', 'midtop', 'topright', 'midleft', 'center', 'midright', 'bottomleft', 'midbottom', 'bottomright']) – The point of the widget that the position argument is referencing. Defaults to ‘topleft’.

  • surface (Optional[Surface]) – The surface that the widget should be rendered to. Defaults to None to use the current display surface.

  • sub_widget (bool) – Whether the widget being made is part of another parent widget. If it is, it will not be added to the widget handler. Defaults to False.

align

Decorator that updates the _requires_alignment property to True.

None
